visualizations

BloomFilter

Functions

calculate_false_positive_rate(n, f, k)

Calculates the false positive rate for a Bloom Filter given n, f, and k.

plot_false_positive_rate_vs_hash_functions(n, f, max_k)

Plots the false positive rate vs. the number of hash functions.

Module Contents

class visualizations.BloomFilter(n: int, f: float, k: int = None)
n

Maximum number of elements the filter is designed to hold.

Type:

int

f

Desired false positive rate for the filter.

Type:

float

m

Size of the bit array, calculated based on f and n to meet the desired false positive rate.

Type:

int

k

Number of hash functions used in the filter. If not provided, it is calculated.

Type:

int

bit_array

Bit array used to store hashed indices, with a size of m.

Type:

bitarray

add(item: str)

Adds an item to the bloom filter.

Parameters:

item – the string to add

query(item: str) → bool

Checks if an item might be in the bloom filter (may have false positives).

Parameters:

item – the string to query

Returns:

True if item might be in the bloom filter, False if it definitely isn’t

Return type:

bool

visualizations.calculate_false_positive_rate(n, f, k)

Calculates the false positive rate for a Bloom Filter given n, f, and k.

Parameters:

  • n – number of elements

  • f – desired false positive rate

  • k – number of hash functions

Returns:

The observed false positive rate.

visualizations.plot_false_positive_rate_vs_hash_functions(n, f, max_k)

Plots the false positive rate vs. the number of hash functions.

Parameters:

  • n – number of elements

  • f – desired false positive rate

  • max_k – maximum number of hash functions to test
